reporting-org.narrative: AICS - Italian Agency for Cooperation and Development

title.narrative: By Youth Side! Servizi di salute inclusivi per i giovani nella lotta all’HIV

description.narrative: Il progetto, della durata di 24 mesi, si struttura in tre principali filoni di intervento: prevenzione dell’HIV, aderenza al trattamento antiretrovirale e lotta allo stigma e alla discriminazione. Queste tre componenti verranno rafforzate appoggiandosi ai servizi di 6 strutture ospedaliere pubbliche selezionate (III, IV e V livello) delle Sub-Contee di Machakos, Kangundo, Kathiani, Mwala e delle rispettive comunità, per una popolazione che beneficia dell’intervento pari a 243.427 persone. La scelta di agire ai livelli III, IV e V è dettata dalla logica di completamento del sistema di riferimento ovvero dalla possibilità di poter osservare, seguire e prendere in carico i pazienti a partire dal livello di accesso ai servizi comunitari al riferimento alla struttura ospedaliera di competenza.

The initiative aims at contributing to the national HIV strategy for achieving universal health coverage, by strengthening the public health system services dedicated to the reduction of new HIV infections, the AIDS-related mortality and the stigma among adolescents and young people, in Machakos County. The indicators adopted by the initiative, excluding the one which has been identified for the General Objective (SDG - 3.3.1), can be attributed to the sets indicated in the Global Fund’s Modular Framework Handbook (2019) and measure the contribution generated by project to the guidelines and priorities sets by the presented national and regional strategic documents. The following indicators will be used: - Number of new HIV infections per 1,000 uninfected population; - Percentage of people living with HIV; Percentage of adolescent girls and young women aged 10-24 years reached with HIV prevention programs; - Percentage of vulnerable population that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results; - Percentage of adults aged 15-24 years on antiretroviral therapy among all adults living with HIV at the end of the reporting period; - Percentage of children (under 15) on antiretroviral therapy among all children living with HIV at the end of the reporting period; - Percentage of young people aged 10–24 years reached by sexuality education and/or Lifeskills–based HIV education in and out of schools.
